summary: This document is an email chain from September 2019 discussing the processing and uploading of documents related to the Epstein case into the Relativity e-discovery platform. It references the Florida investigation FOIA files and notes that due to recent events (likely Epstein's death), active discovery obligations have ceased, but document review for the ongoing investigation continues.

events.title: Document Processing Review
events.description: An email reviews the quality of PDF file creations and indices for Epstein case documents and provides notes for improving the indexing of future materials, such as phone bills.

events.title: Vendor Completion of PDF Files
events.description: A vendor completes creating new PDF files based on 66 PDF files provided in June, with the data ready for review on a flash drive before upload to Relativity.

events.title: Follow-up on Document Processing
events.description: A follow-up email inquires about the ETA for the latest round of document processing, breaking out files, and indexing for the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The correspondence discusses the processing of Epstein case documents for upload into the Relativity e-discovery platform under the folder 'Florida investigation FOIA files'.

It is noted that due to 'the events of this weekend' (likely referring to Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019), active discovery obligations have ceased, but document review for the ongoing investigation continues.
The emails reference multiple rounds of document processing, indicating a systematic effort to review materials, with attention to indexing details like phone numbers for searchability.
A vendor was used to create PDF files from provided materials, with data delivered on a flash drive for review before upload.
